definition: A place where bread, cakes and pastries are made or sold.
examples: The smell of fresh bread filled the bakery.
She works at a small village bakery.

extra.memory_tip: Bakery = building full of warm, tasty loaves.

definition: The person in command of a ship, team or aircraft; to act as the leader of a team or crew.
examples: The ship’s captain greeted the passengers. (noun)
She will captain the hockey team this season. (verb)

extra.memory_tip: Captain = top boss on deck or pitch.

definition: A long period with little or no rain, causing a shortage of water.
examples: Crops failed during the severe drought.
The reservoir dried up after months of drought.
The puppy had big floppy ears.
Wear a floppy hat to shade your face.

extra.memory_tip: Floppy = bendy and loose, not firm.

definition: A natural spring that ejects hot water and steam into the air; in UK English, also a household water heater.
examples: The geyser erupted every hour.
The old bathroom still has a gas geyser.

extra.memory_tip: Geyser = Earth’s boiling kettle spouting skywards.

definition: A glove that covers the hand but not the separate fingers, with a separate section for the thumb.
examples: She wore woollen mittens in the snow.
Baby mittens stop little hands getting cold.

extra.memory_tip: Mitten = cosy sock for your hand.

definition: The sweet liquid produced by flowers that attracts pollinating insects; any delicious drink.
examples: Bees collect nectar to make honey.
The juice tasted like pure nectar.

extra.memory_tip: Nectar = flowers’ sugary drink for bees.

definition: A device of fabric used to slow a fall from an aircraft; to descend by parachute.
examples: The skydiver opened his parachute. (noun)
Troops parachuted into the area. (verb)

definition: A plant that breaks free from its roots when dry and is rolled about by the wind, common in deserts.
examples: A tumbleweed rolled across the empty road.
Desert films often show tumbleweed blowing by.

extra.memory_tip: Tumbleweed = wandering ball of dry plant.

definition: A wrinkled, edible nut with a hard shell; the tree that produces this nut.
examples: She cracked a walnut with a nutcracker.
Walnut trees line the driveway.

extra.memory_tip: Walnut = brain-shaped nut inside a tough shell.
